intro: Ouratea sacleuxii, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a striking tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, flame-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters, with glossy, dark green leaves. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive. The fruit is a small, woody capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
